item.title: Linux Kernel - Deep Dive into Soft/Hard Lockups
item.description: Introduction Kernel Watchdog According to Linux Kernel Documentation, the Linux kernel can act as a watchdog to detect both soft and hard lockups. The Linux Kernel Watchdog is a mechanism that monitors the system for both soft and hard lockups. It is designed to detect when a CPU is stuck in a loop and unable to make progress. When a soft lockup is detected, the watchdog will print a warning message to the system log.
